Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Polygonaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Polygonaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Polygonaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stems twining; leaves with hastate bases; fruiting perianth with keeled segments
Stems erect; leaves rounded, truncate or broadly cordate at base; fruiting perianth distinctly winged
Undersurface of leaves with c. 1 mm long multicellular hairs on veins; leaves usually more than 15 cm long; base cordate; apex acute to shortly acuminate
Undersurface of leaves glabrous, often scabrid or with short hairs on veins when young; leaves mostly less than 15 cm long; base truncate to cordate; apex acuminate to cuspidate
